JGoxXvykcGHQBRpirhhEcQ.text: Definitely the best fish of a fish & chips plate I've ever had, coming from the US that is. I got the cod, the fish was fresh and flaky and the batter was perfect and crisp. I enjoyed it a lot. However, the chips were just normal, they were no better or worse than any other potatoes I've had, haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. cod

-iItm7J-Bnys4THVYATRWQ.text: Food so nice we came here twice!I just randomly found this place on Yelp. We just arrived in london and went straight here, only 5 blocks away from our hotel. We sat outdoors because it was a nice day.. We met other tourists and athletes the same time we went. I ordered the cod and chips. OMG it was amazing!! The fish was very light nad the batter was cooked perfectly. And the tartar sauce! BOMB! the next time I come back to London, this will be my first stop yet again!

kFwLuxqsmsi9tSOiFl3K_g.text: I found this place after yelping a few "Fish and Chips" options.  I thought this was a bit difficult to rate because the "Fish and Chips" were like what you would expect fish and chips to be.  They were good and fresh, but well...they were just as good and fresh as the other places I tried in London that cost less than this "plaice".  If you want some good fish and chips, this is the place for you.  But then again, you could get this else were for less too.  Don't cross it off your list but I'm not sure you need to go out of your way to get here either.  PS - We tried the halibut and plaice.  Both great choices.  I imagine the others would have been as well...

HxZD4g-F2H4d1EsPk_R9pw.text: It was pretty awful. Food had clearly been under the heating lamp for quite a while.   Wait/counter staff were aggressive and rude. Table is filthy.  Same price as your regular fish and chips place, just terrible.  It's hard to mess this up...

6oQmEf6gewiaFh4EytqyAA.text: A friend recommended this "plaice" to me as THE fish & chips shop in London, and I gotta say I agree! Located in the bustling Covent Garden district, the restaurant has good service (it should, since there was always a line out the door the entire time I was there!) and indoor / outdoor seating. I sat outside with a nice pint of Budvar (the *original* Budweiser) and waited for my food to arrive.Though there was a bit of a wait, the food did not disappoint in the least. The chips were nice and hot, as was the sizable piece of sole. Sprinkle lots of malted vinegar on top, get that ketchup for the chips, and wash it all down with the Budvar ... delish!!

TlP5rd36X_x9oyTxpGAE3A.text: I feel like the place was sold. It's not owned by British anymore and the food was not as good as all the other times I was there in the past.

KGzYBMxhEGYyFy0PGaSMcQ.text: I am a northerner and know a good chippie when I come across one. Rock and Sole Plaice kicks ass, serious ass. The chips are big, strangely shaped (this is a good thing) and soft and fluffy. The mushy peas, are a lumpy swamp of green deliciousness. Best of all, the steak and kidney pie was perfect. A slight resistance of crust melts away in to a savoury brown heaven. OH GOD! IT WAS SO GOOD!For eating in or outside on the bench chairs this meal will put you back £7. Taking away is cheaper. For such a big portion of chip shop perfection, Rock & Sole Plaice deserve 5*. The service was somewhat erratic so the critic in me cannot allow a perfect score. Henceforth I bestow this splendid eatery 4*.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

8hDFHFofpIao2qpGE_Jf7w.text: Very decent. Took a while but we had a nice large piece of haddock with a load of chips. It was more than enough to share. Coleslaw was nice too, but very mayonnaise-y. Really basic looking place but typical for a chippie and with ample seating, including picnic tables outside. I had read this place with a tourist trap but it doesn't appear to be the case. Worth a visit.

oCBIpdcGCrMm3P-2qjAEBQ.text: After trying fish and chips by the Victoria Station, I asked myself, there has to be a famous fish and chips joint around here... so I yelped it and I found Rock & Sole Plaice.When we got there, the line was long and outside the door, so this was a good sign!  Inside the restaurant, it was packed and all the tables taken, the line was for take out orders (take away)... but we got seated at their outdoor seating area.I ordered the large cod fish and chips... they have like 8 different kids of fish... so I guess I'll have to try other types of fish with each visit :)The fish was crisp, fried to perfection... the chips were excellent as well... with some vinegar and homemade tartar sauce... oh may... it was excellent.  Fore sure I would go back!  The service was great, prompt and we were out of there within 45 minutes... drop by if you are able too.

FtTlO3bO3Yy1VEe2iPjSFw.text: I yelped this place while in London to make sure that I got really good fish and chips, and these guys didn't disappoint. My friend's tips for fish and chips are to get them in a real restaurant, not a pub, and to get them beer-battered. Well, these weren't beer-battered, but they were delicious all the same. A bit pricey at 15 pounds, but we couldn't lower the price by taking it out since it was pouring outside.

UKGNYUq8W92X2XFLbsQoQA.text: I popped over to the Rock and Sole Plaice on my first night in London, because the friends I had met up with had it on good repute that it was THE place for fish and chips. The first thing that I noticed was that prices are pretty high, so I opted for the sausage and chips, while my friends decided to split a plate of the fish and chips. To be fair, they more than got their money's worth!The food was great, served hot and served quickly. We tucked in outside opposite a group of Londoners (frequented by the locals, always a good sign!), and generally found ourselves at the end of the night fat and happy, with our purses a few pounds lighter (get it?). Notably, the restaurant was packed (though that is understandable given that it was a Friday night), and seating was a bit hard to find. You'll have to be prepared to share a table or bench if you choose to sit outside, but it's nice to socialize with new folks, right?!I'd love to go back and try the fish and chips myself, though I had a few bites from my friends' plate. I admire the wide selection of fish available, and was pleased to finally understand the meaning of 'rock and sole plaice'. Given that it was the only exposure I had to fish and chips, I can't speak as to the comparative quality of R&SP compared with others around (and even if I had, I wouldn't consider myself qualified--any deep fried food seems to break even in my mind and to my tastebuds). I would wager though, that it's a damn good place, given that I'd go back again and I'm not even the biggest fan of seafood. I'd say in sum then, that if you only have one place to grab your fish and chips in London, the Rock and Sole Plaice is as good a choice as any.

j89eon7SceWHGUM1emdU_w.text: Yay, my first proper English fish n chips!!! We were exhausted from walking in the downpour of rain and it was nice to sit down and have a hot cup of mocha and some bomb fish n chips. I got the cod which was huge and so moist with the perfect amount of batter fried to a crisp. After I doused my fish with vinegar and chips with ketchup I somehow managed to scarf it aaaall down. It was such a perfect haven from the long day's trek and gloomy weather, and for less than 12 pounds for everything, it made me sigh in content. It's making my tummy grumble just thinking about it.

Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. cod & chips

ZtRMW0twSAdvOFLQmr7wzQ.text: I'm a born and bred West Londoner, but am currently living in LA. It may seem all bright and sunny here - but there are no fish and chips in sight. So I dream of eating at Rock and Sole Plaice.This place has been here as long as I can remember, the fish is always great, the food comes out piping hot and the chips are exactly how I love them to be. I walk into this place and the warm, stuffy smell of fish and chips rocks my soul! Don't be fooled. The gravy and chicken nuggets are amazing too if you don't fancy fish.The last time we were there, the cook wasn't happy with how our fish was cooked and gave it to us for free! (We're not gourmet chefs but it tasted great to us!) Either way, this kind of service tops off the whole experience..I'll be back as soon as I can!

fgf7NBJGHdAsVLt6Qa4oCg.text: Went there for a quick delicious meal before catching a play.  We got exactly what we wanted.  The fish and chips (halibut) and the cornich pasty were perfect.  We sat at a comfortable little table by the sidewalk.  The service was fast and friendly.

FLamtHtMozNHD9FHJ0O6PQ.text: So the prices do seem intense(ly high) for what you might want to dish out for your fish. Certainly the prime-touristique location dictates a bit of this, but I will say you won't be complaining about the quality of the great British staple Rock & Sole serves you up.As ironic as "battered to perfection" sounds - the fish is deliciously fried to a crispy golden exterior whist remaining light and falkey inside. And the SIZE of the chips- my gosh I didn't know we harvested potatoes this enormous to create such gigantic starchy chunks (genetically modified farming considered). So really unless you're on the brink of starvation I'd say sharing a large portion between 2, or 2 between 3 and so on will get you a better "moneys worth" making this not such an extortionate gastronomic splurge.Sit down on the pleasant picnic benches outside and you won't believe you're parallel to one of London's busiest shopping stretches. Or, what better than a steaming hot bundle of vinegary greased up carbs on the go to keep your fingers (and stomach of course) warm wandering around bustling Covent Garden.

LtCGe4-yc7WZ1M01jGEOKg.text: I strongly disagree with the yelp community on this one...  It was my last night in London and I still hadn't had "fish&chips". I was very glad to stumble on this place through a yelp search. 4stars. Conviently located in the trendy covent garden. Done!  Unfortunately, the trip was a major miss. I had the £15 regular cod dine in option and a british beer. The cod was very stale, oily, and tasteless. The chips were even worse. Cold and dense with oil. I am very sure you can do much better elsewhere. I noticed one reviewer speculated that ownership has changed. Perhaps that's it. At any rate, I would seek other options.Two stars mainly for the location and fairly friendly staff.

dS8tf0MKrfzd2sYuL1pOoQ.text: Awful experience. Fish is pre-fried and very dry. Chips are actually not bad. Rude staff that very hesitate to serve customer. It's like they just want you to pay and go. Unfriendly dining environment. Would go somewhere else to try fish and chips again. AVOID THIS PLACE

lwxzo9N9Gt2RtnU5PlMxfA.text: I read an article that gave rave reviews about this pace, so I specifically sought it out when I came to visit London. I'd have to recommend NOT traveling out of your way to eat here. The fish was extremely bland. If you can drench the fish in tartar sauce and ketchup, you will be able to tolerate it. The chips were probably cooked last week.  And not to mention how EXPENSIVE it was. It was £15 (GBP) which is $22.86 in American Dollars ($). That was for the regular size and did not include a drink that was an additional £2-4. This meal wasn't worth more than $8 (£5) TOTAL. If you wanted the same meal and decided to eat somewhere else, it was literally £5 cheaper (that's $8 freaking dollars!!). I was expecting this food to taste like HEAVEN in my mouth. Wrong! The service left much to be desired. Overall...not worth a visit unless you just happen to be walking by, all of the stores/restaurants near are closed and you just HAVE to eat here and spend all of that money! Never again!

UQ9jYf_rgW3aJ_bL9VaAQg.text: Rock & Sole Palice stole our London Fish & Chips virginity. With grace and manners, like a gentleman. A hole in the wall joint with a few tables outside, a few on the first floor by the kitchen, and then more seating in the dungeon like, underground water themed room - so you can easily conjure up images of where the meal you are enjoying came from. Especially awesome is the mural of sharks eating each other. Same species cannibalism with dinner? Yes. Please. But really, once I got over the fact that they actually batter and fry the fish up with the skin still on it. I ate that shit up like I was in an eating contest. The fries were french, the fish was fried, and the tartar sauce was the perfect combination of dill and sauce. It was exactly like you would picture the loss of your London fish and chips virginity - it's a weird location, but after said and done, you have no regrets. Cheers!

EROIEb918HG6twzStBRdMw.text: Budget travelers, probably best to get your fish and chips elsewhere.15 pounds to have your fish and chips there or 10 pounds for takeaway.Of course, we opted for the takeaway since it was a pleasant day to eat outside.Service was lacking. It was not very busy, so they could have been more attentive. Staff only asked if I wanted vinegar on the fish.Thinking we had lemon and tartar sauce, we walked away. About two blocks later, my friend and I check our boxes to find that we weren't given any of the usual accompaniments to fish and chips. She walked back to get them.The fish was fried well and still moist, but it lacked seasoning. So disappointing. Most of the chips were soggy and they also needed some more salt. Sure we were take-away customers paying less, but I think the staff should ensure that we enjoy our food as well.

JX2wf3OUPwMg6Fx8KGFgVA.text: First fish and chips in Great Britain. I was hungry and ordered a large cod and when she brought it out....Wow it was a huge order. Barely finished the fish and left a few chips.Way better than we have in the states and the oil was fresh and the cod wonderful. Cooked fresh, not sitting out under a lamp! Talk about bust my belt, plus the young lady serving us was wonderful!Bottom line would I come back.....hell yes!! Grin

3Pc26iYeYE_woi46KTrbVw.text: Seriously delicious. Recommended by a friend from the states, a little hole in the wall with fresh fish and potatoes. I would recommend getting the fish fingers to share for two.

1sdoFIw7mV7MGz5XHkocjA.text: Good fish and chips. Should be on any tourists list of places to eat in London.We tried the cod and haddock. Can't really tell he difference between the two haha. Chips weren't very crispy.

m-1D5isFOIUNvpzt1s_FhQ.text: Its a shame that in Covent Garden such a poor quality fish&chips shop. Ive been here twice just to give second chance unfortunately we left the place unhappy on both occasions. Firstly, overpriced what they serve. Second and main issue is chips were not fresh, just soggy. We  asked for fresh ones to be cooked received the same chips recooked ! Oil what the fish cooked in was not fresh. The fish was dripping in oil on the plate. We left the whole plate chips and half of our fish, staff did not pay attention and bother questioning the full plate.

dJ7nczJ0Nbl8gTgrASKMBA.text: Was craving fish and chips and this place hit the spot. My kids had never eaten fish n chips before and they enjoyed it immensely. These guys serve sausages and pies too, we tried the beef sausage and chicken pie, both were delicious.

Drdb6_B8ZZsK-7Rwpg1mdA.text: I did a take away order in the afternoon time, the guy(not the young one) was providing a bad service. I got the Cod fish with no Tartar sauce... Bad...

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. The take away order from yesterday night, pretty good, everything(especially Tartar sauce) is included in the bag!
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Take away order, the person didn't give out the tartar sauce.... So don't forget to check before you go.

-JrXbuEe6L50tm_mLh_hiw.text: The Fish and Chips were actually quite perfect. The fish was super crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It is going to cost you about 30$ a person so I wouldn't suggest eating here if you are on a budget. Also, it is important to know that there are restaurants that serve Fish and Chips on every corner so don't settle if you aren't happy with the price, environment or the long lines. I didn't eat the mushy peas because I am not a fan of peas to begin with so I don't know how that tasted.

VyKwcjx9VX0CbgKYiZa0Dw.text: When in UK, i told myself, i gotta try Fish & Chips -- the real stuff; the authentic stuff because all the fish and chips I have had in CA aren't that great. When I stepped into Rock & Sole Plaice, i noticed two different menus. One is for take out and the other is dine in. The Dine-in menu was much more pricey. But because we have no place to go eat and it was raining so we had to eat in the little place. There were only 5 tables inside the place (they do have outdoor seating, I would totally sit outside and people watch if it wasn't raining).Water is not free; so you might as well order a beer or soda.I ordered the Cod (regular) for £15. when the dish came out, oh my the Cod was HUGE! i can't imagine how big it would have been if it was a large order. The Fish was meaty & flaky and the batter was not heavy. The chips were alright, then again you're talking to someone who prefers skinny / thin fries. Overall the dish was just alright; it didn't wow me nor impressed me for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. menu
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod (reg) 15.00

HImBqkbQgohDv0Jbj-8JTA.text: Delicious fish n chips. Was disappointed with the food generally in London, coming from the Toronto food scene. But these fish n chips were absolutely amazing. The service was exceptional, the place and restrooms were clean and well maintained. Really enjoyed the meal here.Too: I got the Plaice, their local fish and it was so fluffy and light I loved it

ls0mNqjTRufiKOgPdv_MYQ.text: There's a lot of places selling fish and chips in the theater area so it's hard to pick which one to go to. This came recommended online as one of the few non-tourist traps in the area. The regular portion was large and the chips were very good. The fry was perfect although I'd say the fish was just a tad dry, barely noticeable.

B1OIy53MbzNtQfVZxvA1OQ.text: We HAD to try fish & chips while is London so went here.  It was ok. We both got the fish & chips. I also tried a Cornish pastie which was very dry with a lot of bread and not much meat. What is it in London and Paris that all they want is bread?  The staff was nice although our server didn't know what was in the Cornish pastie. I had to ask her to find out.

xckIUQRpnxotsmOZh310_A.text: 3.5 but I'm feeling optimistic today. I like fish & chips, but not to a point that I'd venture out somewhere just to search for them. Conveniently, Rock & Sole is located near the covent garden tube stop, which is pretty much in the middle of everything. Liked the batter, liked the chips, liked the sauce, was not super impressed by the cod. It's a little bit too fishy for my taste, and a little less flaky than ideal. I guess I was spoiled by the fresh seafood in San Francisco and Seattle therefore had my expectation set too high. The place is small and casual,  great for a quick bite, not so good a sit-down lunch date. But don't underestimate the price, £14 for per serving, ouch.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Plaice
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

COGjWISWZCbEoaE5Rf963g.text: Not too far from Covent gardens, this is a great place to sit and have some fish and chips. Note there are two prices and experiences. If sitting at a table whether inside our out the prices are more and there is service added. If on a budget then be sure to get it to go.There are multiple types of fish to choose from and is delivered quick to the table. It is delicious and not dry or greasy.

YzBaLhL_-Rc8KzL9AKegnA.text: maybe it is the best fish and chip in London or UK. However you have to know fish and chip is not that good taste.the shop is with a strong smell and the staff are not nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. The top one is the large size of cod

Pe0ISZ1z5IDFnHFHlXg_9A.text: Other than football, authentic fish and chips is why we came to England.  The atmosphere is perfect, dont let the mismatched chairs throw you off this the best fish and chips place I have found.  Both the cod loin and the haddock are out of this world!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod loin... awesome

WyS9-kBuwB4G2Fl9e68zNQ.text: The best fish and chips I've ever had!   The haddock one is especially very tasty and more flavorful than the cod.   The haddock is not fishy at all.  They also have a very good mild vinegar that taste very good with the chips.  I didn't care too much of the types of chips/fries they used (larger pieces than I'm normally used to in the States), still not a big deal at all since the fish are excellent.  My family also tried the calamari appetizer, which is also very good and fresh.   Quick and friendly service,  but do try to get outside seating if weather permits.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

dd3mYLsM0UcXhyM1pLSiCg.text: Rock and Sole Plaice was featured on an episode of "Guy and Hunter's European Adventure" on Food Network, so I decided to make it a mission to grab some fish and chips while I was in London.  It did not disappoint, the fish and chips were fantastic, the portions were huge...plus they have local beer, which is enough to sell me on a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips plus a London Pride...Cheers Mate!
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

HPcNOfb245CKDe97MOEVlQ.text: This was the best fish and chips we have ever tasted. Our server , Pedro, provided amazing service above and beyond.  Not only did he provide excellent hospitality but he had a great personality and made our dinner enjoyable. Moreover, he provided us some additional information on that made our trip to London awesome! Note to Pedro: # Si nos robaron  el mobil combo digiste!

UYx_SErV-yXUnPGW57DfdA.text: Best fish and chips ever! Huge dish and very well priced.I came here because i saw the restaurant on TV.Great choice!

ESL6XiFw7lEIelOjiFtbmQ.text: It's good that this place is geared towards tourists, as it guarantees they won't come back the next day and complain. The service was awful, the fish was decent but the chips were soggy, and the overall impression left a bad taste in our mouths.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

C4-OIh9ONQHjFPWnACRq7A.text: Very very OK place. Not fabulous. Not bad. Very spendy. Very decent.

6oBzODFcE2m3dxcS0Klbqw.text: The fish and chips here are pretty extraordinary! A bit pricey for my liking but honestly very very high standard of fish and chips! If you're visiting London 'tis worth a try!!

SBmimmQPR0ywqFHfin9cgA.text: Five stars is an insult. This place is really worth 1000 stars. Flew to London and tried this place after someone recommended it for fish and chips. Man was i amazed how good it was!!!!!! if you in London you Got to try it!!!!

OWBRWgwPKImiLw9PB5SLxw.text: Since living in London I have to come accept that most of the decent traditional fish and chip shops have gone for good. As a northern girl I know a good fish and chip shop when I see one. The only place I have found so far in London is the amazing Rock and Sole Plaice of Covent Garden.Yes the prices are London a little OTT and that's what I've come to expect in this city but at this little gem I will grin and bare the cost as the fish and chips here are out of this world! Everything from the interior of the chippy, to the service, to the gorgeous fish and proper chips is fantastic. I love that it's stayed traditional and you don't get the thin, French fries style chips as in most of London's take-away places. They have a huge range of different fish to select from and my mouth is watering now just thinking about them! I love this chip shop-it's the best I've ever been to (in London anyway!)

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. The best chippy in town!

kr1oYyVackmjg-ERD2S1xA.text: We were more than happy to have a couple of fish & chip meals here.  Had read about the place beforehand and luckily we were staying nearby at The Montague on the Gardens so it warranted a visit.  It is a very simple place.  But to us the service was prompt and courteous. Moreover, our meals were quite good.  They've got tables outside if you prefer.

nckEWb_rMN78w-gKkbWvhg.text: There are a lack of sit down fish and chips places in central London, so when I saw this one with its wonderful name I was keen to check it out. It a couple of streets away from the main Covent Garden / Neal Street drag and so feels a lot more relaxed. The restaurant itself is positioned on the corner of a crossroads with outside seating and two floors of seating inside. The fish bar is on the ground floor by the entrance (though if you're eating in there is waiter service). It's best to go when it is sunny and sit outside, though failing that the downstairs has a general undersea theme which is charming in that slightly rubbish way. I've grown up in the south, not by the sea, which somewhat disqualifies me from judging these things, but I've never been particularly impressed by the food at this place. Everything is as it should be in terms of format and appearance, unfortunately the food is pretty London chip shop generic. This would be fine but the prices and general feel of the place promise something better. A pleasant enough place, convenient located if you're a tourist interested in trying fish and chips, though unfortunately the actual food is fairly average.

lvA-kQxImudAhs3pvirPow.text: The Rock & Sole plaice is my favorite place for the traditional fish&chips meal during summers. This in not only because of the excellent food, but also because of the nice outdoor seating. You can have some beer, food, and fresh air, sun set.. hah haa, well it is still in Covent Garden!Also at this area it is hard to find any place that authentic as it is all so touristic. This place is hidden to a more quiet street, well at least away from the shops. The only downside is the restaurant itself. I would not call it charming. With a little decoration they could do major improves and I don't understand how come they don't seem to care? Until that happens I will just keep sitting outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

4reS_Ylk_NWX5NNoywF5lw.text: Rock and Sole is a very casual fish and chips restaurant in the Covent Garden area.  My favorite fish and chips place I've been to so far is Golden Hind and this doesn't stack up.  The fish and chips weren't as golden as they should be (too dark which typically means the oil is not changed enough) and the batter wasn't crispy enough.  Golden Hind is also a better value.  I also wouldn't recommend eating in.  The restaurant's a little cramped and not very pleasant.

Bh_QFFEJi1140u7jUkieYA.text: Yummy fish and chip shop! A must GO!!!! If you're visiting London for the first time or not.....you're probably going to be stopping by covent garden anyways, so you should stop in for some fish and chips and a pint! Don't forget to pile on the malt vinegar!!!!!! Large portions....and that's what us Americans need with the GBP conversion!! Shiiiiish!Enjoy, wankers!! =)

WoenK3xWpKQvPc_79TplzQ.text: Well what can I say?  I thought it was supposed to be good, it wasn't.I've eaten here before, about 2 years ago, and my wife an I enjoyed it.  I came back this time for a quick lunch on a Sunday and I couldn't have been more disappointed.  First, they were out of Haddock, then they had no large portions of anything.  Basically, all they had was Cod.  OK, give Cod a try.  To be honest, the regular portion was more than enough, especially considering the quality.  The fish wasn't bad, in fact it was OK.  The chips were soggy, the tarter sauce which had been sitting out on the table was runny and just not good.  OK, doctor the fries with some salt and vinegar...and the salt shaker pours out salt like a rushing faucet.  Now I have soggy chips covered in salt.  I order a bottle of still water with my meal...no water.  I keep trying to get the attention of the server, but she's too busy to notice or care.  I would have gotten it myself except she sat a group next to me blocking me in and I was just not going to make everyone move...until it was time to leave.  That didn't take long as I really didn't eat much of my meal.  13.50 and I walked out completely disappointed.Would I return  - NOWould I recommend to a friend - NOWas it a good value for the money - NO

ddV71dhU_Hgj86PKG1dIGA.text: I love this fish & chip shop; their chips are nice and thick and I love their curry sauce - chips & curry sauce, it's a great combination! It is a little on the pricey side but it is in Covent Garden so I guess you've got to expect it, the portions are massive though and the chips so good you don't seem to mind the cost.

NBjJsXJUTTVYn_24yFD6pw.text: Staff were fine  location is really good to pull tourists and visitors in  each get a starBUT!If you are going to sell the (former) national dish to tourists (chicken tikka masala at present, doner kebab next!!!), then at least do it how the rest of Britain enjoys it!!!!! This seems to be attempt to provide a gimmicky 'artisan' touch to Fish and Chips  it really needs not to be that complicated!If you are a tourist and want fish and chips how regular Brits have them then don't go to the 'oldest' fish and chip shop. If you want to pretend you are eating it how it was done so over 100 years ago then fair enough! Price-wise? See for yourself and judge!Not my cup of tea.

pA29XVocuJd0Z1Q87Dz6-Q.text: Fish amazing. A bit short staffed if sitting outside, but if you want some legit fish and chips. Come and enjoy!

F8BCqCy_IKqPc4dbIM8TNA.text: Is rock also a type of fish? I just wondered how far the pun extended. Fish and Chip shops love a pun as much as The Sun but I'm not holding that against this plaice. It really is good quality. I've lived by the sea for a while and used to be close to one of the best fish and chip shops in Scotland and this ranks pretty well. They're not particularly strong on lots of the ethical fishing issues but if you're looking for a good version of a classic in a great bit of town for a meal you could do a lot worse. If you had to pick just one season to go in it'd have to be the summer but it's open whenever and is consistently good at what it does.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

HhrBpY-Zc1XhCqb5T6pAgQ.text: This place holds it down properly for the fish and chip.  Its an average looking place with not a lot of room to sit in, but it was definitely the best fish and chips we had in London.  The fish was fresh, not dried out, and the batter was light and crispy.  You can't ask for much more!

q9m-wucGUsMh8VIMNiWNxQ.text: Really good tasting fish and chips, and staff really friendly toowould recommend if visiting Covent Garden

epsM0iKNIEScrr2NzKr9vA.text: This was the first place i tried when I got in.  Love the neighbor and was window shopping and was excited to eat and go shopping after. The fish was cooked to perfection and good chips.  You have to try the sticky toffee here, it came hot and was perfect is a cool afternoon.  It is touristy but you see the local usually doing take out during lunch.

V09vIs_KEevleMSU9M3bzA.text: Nice outdoor seating to watch the world go by. There are also tables downstairs but you need to go behind the counter to get to the stairs. Once downstairs you are in an underwater world.

KJZH-qyRLk-KSOeyXvpviQ.text: As my first "official" fish and chips in London, I have to yell "Hooray!" The chips have this strange crunchy, yet soft consistency with is awesome. I did get the mushy peas just to and as a non-pea lover - they were delicious! You get to choose from several kinds of fish, I chose the Sole and I was floored by how large it was! I swear it took up half the plate.I went mid-October, it was a beautiful day, the line was out the door and was lucky enough to snag a table out front! The service was fairly quick, no complaints.

fMhNAOINNtTgjNl4lWJabw.text: Based on our guide book, this is the oldest, or one of the oldest, Fish and Chips places in London.  Fish and chips shops played a big role for the Brits in the 2nd World War as they held neighborhood meetings to see which areas in their community needed food the most.  And...oh forget the history lesson and let's move on to the food!It's tucked in Covent Garden and it is worth every damn step of the way.  Tables inside, outside were all full.  Heck, if tables could be hammered on the wall, I would take one to eat here again.  You can get two type of portions and the hammock that I ordered only came in large that night.  The chips were potato-y and the fish was just fried to perfection.  Nothing fancy, just fish and chips.  A tin of ketchup and tartar sauce.  A bottle of malt vinegar and have at it.There were 2 Japanese tourist in front of us as we waited and the hostess asked them to follow her in.  When she walked in and didn't see them, she looked at us and said, "Too slow, come with me."  You snooze, you lose.  I don't know if they waited, but they lost their table, just like that *snap*.  So be patient and wait for your table, but more importantly, be alert.  Don't lose out on your table because you were too busy taking pictures or looking at other people eat.£30 for 2 with 2 sodas, and 2 fish and chips orders.

QokrKbitYRVB9R35TxhVRg.text: I'll give the food 4-stars, but the service 1 as 0 is not an option.  Upon being seated and given menus  last month (16 August 2010), the waitress returned to tell us they were closing the kitchen early and we had no choice - 3 small orders of cod or nothing.  We took it, and it was excellent, but about about a dozen more people were allowed to order what they wanted for take away.  MID-meal, we were repeatedly reminded that they wanted to close up (there were 2 other tables seated).  Further, it took 3 people to understand our request for TARTAR SAUCE for my 11 year old nephew.  He asked the waitress and she told him of their selection of BEERS before asking for help. She literally had to bring out 2 other people before we were understood.  Though they acknowledged that they did not speak English well, they knew enough to tell us to leave before we were finished eating!

YTPNvBoQ2d_xVnVWdnbC5A.text: I've been going here for who knows how long, and the clienteles sure have changed, but it doesn't change the fact that the fish & chips are still as crisp as I remember back in the day. I always recommend this place every time a friend decides to visit, and sure enough, they leave happy as I do every time I show my face here. Good job, Rock & Sole Plaice, you sure have won my little heart.

sAhGHYHbBOjITLGPJYt8mg.text: When I used to live in London this was my hands down favourite chippy in the West End. Quality Haddock and Cod, excellent chips. Just a very consistent chippy that's been doing Fish & Chips forever. This is traditional London in a nut shell. Not upscale, not cheap either, but when you need to fill that craving, this is the place.

aQQ0Opy3mS7CkkfIwTzgFw.text: 5 star Fish & Chips.I was wandering around Covent Garden, starving, when I found this restaurant using the Yelp iPhone application. With a 4 star rating it didn't seem like a gamble and I wasn't disappointed.I ordered the Sole and it was by far the best Fish & Chips I have ever had. The piece of fish was huge (I ordered the regular, I can't imagine how big the large would have been) and tasted wonderful. They didn't go over board with the batter, which is always a good thing, and the chips were thick-cut and tasty.I'd recommend this place (or plaice) in a heartbeat, especially to visitors looking for their first fish & chip experience. The only problem is they probably won't enjoy fish & chips anywhere else after they've eaten here.

CWnsPD3_oLf9FlKN_iHISA.text: By far this is the best fish & chips I've ever had.  Simply amazing.We yelped to find the best fish & chips restaurant in London, and we found this place.Their food is just terrific.  Far better than the average fish & chips you'll find in a neighborhood pub.  I liked the fact that they offer various kinds of fish to choose from, cod, haddock, etc., which is fun if you are a group.  The only negative is that they only offer a couple of kinds of bottled beer.  I wish they had a broader selection on tap to choose from.

xOKgL_BUqlYguzwkL0KyrA.text: I stumbled upon Rock &Sole Plaice on a rocking Sunday afternoon in Covent Garden. I had read the reviews, but I wasn't necessarily looking to eat there. However, hunger took hold and in I went. I went for the recommended Cod, just a regular, and some mushy peas to make it at least a little bit healthy. The fish is very tender and moist, the fries are ok, nothing special, and the peas are mushy peas. They do add some nice color to the dish and  a bit of flavor when eating everything together.My bill with a bottle of water came to £17.50, but 1) the company is paying 2) I didn't have to eat again that day 3) It was a vacation day 4) You're in Covent Garden.I'd come back. One let down is that there doesn't seem to be a single "real" Brit to be found, but what can you do? If you want Fish & Chips made by an authentic Brit these days, you have to travel outside London.

WG_KiSnaMGto-mqHFGujpA.text: This is one of the best fish and chip joints in London? I beg to argue.  Literally I can only give it a passable rating... for the price (£10 for reg fish and chips) I was expecting something more as I've had some pretty amazing fish and chips for around that price (and in London albeit outside Central London).I was under-impressed with the wait staff as well as the fish, asked me to take a seat once I got the front of line and said I'd eat in and then proceeded to take orders from the 10 people who were in line after me before coming to to my table to take my order (couldn't I have just ordered in line)? Dropped of my f&c when it was ready and dropped was really the appropriate word there and forgot my drink until halfway through my meal.  I know this is a small mom and pop style place so I wasn't expecting great service, but I've had better at smaller f&c places so wasn't even up to par with them.Fish was just okay: batter was far from anything special, fish didn't taste particularly moist or fresh and the chips were soggy.  I'm not trying to be a Debbie Downer here, clearly many of you love this place so maybe it was just an off day, but there are just too many f&c places to explore in this town for me to ever venture here again unless I hear of some massive change in what they currently offer.I think it's suppose to be a very old fish&chips place (although doesn't look any older than it's 1980's decor) so I guess maybe that's the biggest appeal here?

h6Z0K4n1JBS21O9_baBLoA.text: If you are looking for authentic fish and chips this place is great. Definitely not a fancy atmosphere which seems to add to the experience. Several types of fish to choose from and the tastes are great.  So I give this 5 stars as a "must visit" place with a fun, chippie atmosphere and great food.  Don't expect white tablecloth and wine glasses, or you may be disappointed.

IarFLdXZS5PA4ubz2X2vkA.text: Great location for a brilliant chip shop. Possibly the best chip shop piece of battered cod I've ever had - there was something about the taste of it that justified the Central Covent Garden level cost! Really good quality good tasting fish. The chips didn't match up to it and were a little soggy but I defintely recommend the fish!

pWkJ0xoua-FfsHYY90ocEg.text: Mind you, I am not a fan of "fish and chips" so this review may be a bit biased, but I decided I had to try it seeing as this place was supposedly famous for this typically English dish.For the 15 pounds I paid for my meal (cod fish and chips, tea and diet coke) I felt completely ripped off. Oil soaked and average overall. And seriously, what the hell is up with two different prices for take out or eating inside? I was definitely confused by this.3 stars simply for the fact that a local Londoner told me to go here and I really have no idea  what a "good" fish and chips meal tastes like. Maybe it is good and I'm just dumb.

8CK0OhBtMm6va8uWOXZ_uQ.text: the pieces of the cod and haddock we got were huge! but other than the generous size, it was pretty disappointing. i know you're suppose to eat it with tartar sauce and malt vinegar, but i do appreciate fish with just batter alone between some bites. both the fish and chips were super oily and pretty tasteless.

ecpVHkatMPXXhgLNSL3MTg.text: Fantastic food and the fish was perfectly cooked, even the tarter sauce was excellent.  They have seating inside and outside.  The service was very fast and friendly.

VeXWg5q4x_ibadA25ED1pQ.text: It's a place that's living on its' reputation, hence the ridiculous prices and table policy (wanna eat outside? That's an inside price to you!)... but it has to be said, the fish is as tasty as ever and the chips are nice, warming and thick. How chips should taste, not covered in oil but not bone-dry either. Fine for the food, but be prepared to nark about the price afterwards.

TBinuTEbAQtXiSSgfa9M-Q.text: Cod was fine but nothing special. Scampi was mostly bread.  Chips were average.    Crowded shop.  Prices are quite high for fish and chips. But the tartar sauce was great.

B5UoKJUlJR9rJ7sXhRmIgQ.text: LOVED LOVED LOVED. Excellent cod fish and chips! Great if you are near Covent Gardens.

tGg2uHF5YCM3KJZOcXnbKw.text: Plenty of fish/shark and chips.The place could look cheap, and the romans inside a lil bit scary. But everything will be fine and you'll be finally happy to eat something oily !

Jlt3KTObdzYFsSoYU31opg.text: Rock and Sole Plaice has to be one of the best fish and chip shops I have ever been to. The chips are cooked to perfection, golden and crispy whilst maintaining that traditional chip taste that defines Britain. When some relatives of mine came over from Canada, it was a must visit to show them what fish & chips are all about.You are able to sit in and eat meals too. Price wise you would have thought a place like this could charge premium prices but they resist, charging that of an average chippy which is a refreshing change from most money grabbing establishments in town.Rock & Sole Plaice is well worth going out of your way for if you are in the Central London area,

-YB-HSuWxV5kft3g6Iib5Q.text: Great fish & chips - and the servings are huge.  The tartar sauce and the savory curry sauces are incredible.  Try one of their gerkins as well - fast and friendly service

dXLqa_ZoaT233_dxOhZj8g.text: Not bad.  It was fish and chips and it tasted pretty good.  So I'll insert this caveat...I had fish and chips from several places while in London and my palate could not distinguish huge differences so maybe you should completely discount my review.The service was a bit slow and I got spotted as a non-native in 2 seconds but that's my own cross to bear.So bottomline, if you want fish and chips and are in the area, go for it, but in my opinion Rock and Sole ain't worth traveling more than a couple tube stops.

UQ-PD0DsOWArehko3gm_Tg.text: 1. Service - waiters were attentive, but can be friendlier. They didn't seem to be as welcoming as I am use to at other places. It's A-La-Carte, so you wait to be seated, order and pay at the table. 2. Price - affordable and it's a big bang for the buck. The food portion is a lot for just one person. 3. Ambiance - there are outdoor and indoor seatings. Depending on the season, one or the other may be more preferred. We went there during the summer, so we had outdoor seatings. The ambiance is quite nice. A good place for a date. Dress code here is casual. I rather have my own table though. We were arranged to sit with strangers. I guess they wanted to maximize their seatings, but the tables weren't full at the hour we were there. A little awkward. 4. Food - we were so hyped up because this was our first British Fish and Chips experience. It was very bland and we weren't impressed at all. The chips were too fried.5. Cleanliness -I didn't observe anything bad. It felt clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Fishfingers 9.00
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Store Front

xNZoOjCULuaZ04viLBDZ1A.text: When in jolly ole London .. have a haddock chipper at RSP! Top it off with a bit of Sarsons and enjoy  be sure to arrive before the after work rush hour . A reg order may just possibly feed a famished party of 5

r5gkjtpMJwF9SGsgXJvyYg.text: This place was recommended by a couple of local friends, and it was good! Big slab of cod and of course chips. The chips were crispy and thick. The cod was a bit bland - but that's how cod tastes. The menu offered other options including sole, rockfish, and other flounders. One of my friends ordered mushy peas, which were good. Free wifi and outlets to charge our phones were a plus! Service was good too. I can tell that this is a place that lots of tourists eat at. Thankfully I noticed there was one table of British ladies.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Classic cod loin dish

F1IK5Piu3EbFn83Bj6BZ0w.text: Pretty good fish and chips; fish was very fresh and fried very well, chips are also very good. Other than the fish, I ordered the shrimp. Was good, but not special; the specialty here is definitely the fish. Also had a really great hot chocolate. Servers were friendly and accommodating even with many customers.Overall good find for a solid place with good quality fish and chips, wasn't out of this world amazing but still a very enjoyable experience.

DZ9ksdPB_-KMnrbs9eOYpQ.text: I HAVE to go here and indulge myself. Even on a stopover I head into town to treat my to this fish and chips heaven :)Now they renovated the outside seating area with installing some sun shades - smart. But the inside is pretty much the same since my first meal here some decades ago. . . And the quality is as high as always. I love this place and take my friends out here or set up meetings with clients. Simple chick like only the British can provide . . .

0MJX4blclh75ZT80JzfW5g.text: When you want a tasty, straightforward, no frills but solid plate of fish and chips, this is where it's at. I came here about 3 years ago and remember loving it then and the same was the case now. Super fresh fish, battered and fried to perfection. And he chips are amazing! Plenty of potato but still crunchy on the outside. Mmmmmm. The curry sauce is an excellent addition to your plate, so pick up a side of that. Really excellent all around. Can't wait to come back and have another round.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

_oAHXIz_gVvSGFKiNpHrrg.text: We tried 3 Fish and Chip locations during our stay in the United Kingdom, this was the best Fish and Chips. The fish was light and not greasy. They charge you extra to eat inside the restaurant. A little crowded and tight inside the restaurant but food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Large portion of Fish and Chips, light not greasy.

6ySincVuKbVFb0VlWZba1w.text: Yummmmm. Quality food, fair price and fast service. Their tartar sauce is basically crack in a cup. Go for lunch!

vmCyRh-gd29he38br6k-wg.text: I very much enjoyed the fish and chips here. It's not cheap but the service was quick and friendly and the food was good. We shared one plate of fish and chips because the portions are huge. Their fish is apparently locally sourced and sustainable, so you can feel a little better about eating here. It's worth nothing that if you choose to eat in the restaurant versus takeaway, you'll pay more for your meal. I for one welcome the chance to sit down after a long day of sightseeing and it's worth the extra money, but if you are on a budget please beware. You can choose the type of fish that you want, from cod to haddock to sole. The menu is obviously fish-heavy but they do have chicken nuggets for kids. Speaking of kids, if you have any in tow they will want to check out the menu (and inevitably laugh at the "spotted dick" on offer). I like that there's outdoor dining year round (we were wearing our winter coats and munching on crispy fried fish and chips al fresco). Throw in a couple of good beers and you've got yourself a nice evening in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Storefront at night.

VMoDDn74S8TS5aKvDnrMqg.text: Food: Ordered fish and chips. You get a huge piece of cod. They were good. But how good and fish and chips be? We also ordered pies and these were very popular and tasted better than fish and chips.Service: Excellent and friendly.Atmosphere: Clean, bright, and modern.

l8PzkUQM24O4pTAF8nrz_Q.text: We had to eat here because the patio looked amazing, little did we know that they are one of the oldest fish and chip places in London. My husband and I each got a plate and the portions are huge - my recommendation is sharing a plate between 2. The tartar sauce is amazing with hints of dill.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

j-Ukc6zgc_pIBbk5F9eIDw.text: Review was from a week ago. Family of four eating in the restaurant. Sat in the secondary dining room. Showed up with no reservations to this busy restaurant (plan ahead and make reservations). They found us a table in the adjoining dining room. Order arrived quickly. Very good fish and chips. If you are in a rush to get to a show and want fish and chips then this place will work for you.

-QP30ENHZ_ySJAUsJ5QwrQ.text: We went there because this is the oldest fish and chip place so we thought the quality should be consistently pretty good. What a disappointment!!! Three of us choose different fish: cod, haddock and sole.  They were consistently dry, smelly (not fresh) and tasteless.  The chips were subpar also - not crispy and tasteless and just starchy bGood thing they gave us lots of ketchup packs so we could soak everything and stand to eat enough so we don't go hungry.  The price was not cheap either!

g_5u8R_Dwfs9xBCzX3RCOA.text: Was a bit bland for my taste and a bit pricey. A little over 20 pounds for two take away meals.

xN6Q3DRZ_eU6s7ZUI6dl2w.text: Stopped on a Friday night...great service and large portions. Service was super. Had the haddock fish & chips ...yum!

Zuwn05ypPRgyluSRBK6hEg.text: Tried a couple of things on the menu, the fish & chips & the onion and cheese pie. The fish was great, probably the best I have ever tried. I picked skate which had bones but I imagine some of the fish do not have bones. The batter was not greasy, the fish was cooked perfectly. The chips were OK, a little crunchy, a little soft. The onion & cheese pie was good. Sat outside and enjoyed the atmosphere. Worth a visit if you want great fried fish.

WJW7OhCBDhNT0Fd-YghZwQ.text: I love the location and atmosphere. There's a lot of history as well, being the oldest fish and chips restaurant in London. And if you're in London, you have to eat fish and chips, right? The whole restaurant has a maritime decor, with walls featuring large photos of boats and the sea - a really great backdrop for photos! I ordered a London Pride and the plaice and chips. First of all, the portions are huge!! Better to split a starter and a main between two people. I really loved the fish but the fries were awful. But I don't think it's specific to this location, because British "chips" just seem to be very big and not crisp. I think it's just a cultural preference, because I live in Belgium, home of the best fries!Would definitely recommend this location to anyone visiting London wanting authentic British food!

Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. London Pride
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Exterior

7JmtcbksDirXRcomi2NvGQ.text: Really nice restaurant in the heart of town. Pretty loud and crowded but the food is really good. Also has a nice beer selection. Parking is hard...

cCIPtDSiTzPKWSIpt9iAcg.text: This is the first Fish and Chips I've tried in London and I must say, it didn't disappoint. It might be a little too hefty for fish and chips, but as a tourist, I don't really mind paying a little extra.A friend of mine brought me here, they have good outdoor dining and some decent seats downstairs. I arrived here at 11am and by 12 noon it was packed! I suggest arriving a little early.Now food, food, I really don't expect much from English food, a lot of Asians (like me) say it's really boring since it's all fried food, potatoes and pies. For me this was actually outstanding because despite the lack of "seasoning" you'd get from Asia, British people are very particular with the method of cooking and the simple quality of its ingredients--very European. Rock and sole has choices for different kinds of fish for their fish and chips. We tried halibut and cod, and both were amazing. They serve it with the usual tartar sauce but they also have malt vinegar and salt on the table. I urge you to experiment and use the malt vinegar and salt and all the condiments on the table, it'll make your experience here worthwhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. COD!

evH6XuNCi0Dz1e_LfVHQHg.text: Recommended by the hotel for awesome fish and chips and it really was . Very hip, authentic , delish and friendly service . In the theatre district of London Cool place

kyRLl510X4v_HWLpjXh6HA.text: I've been here once before but this is the first time that I'm able to leave a review so here goes!!!I ordered the Large Cod Fish and Chips and it came within a couple of minutes.  The fish itself was one large piece (as if they took one side of the fish, battered it and deep fried it...skin an all).  Along side it was a healthy portion of fries.This is bar far the best Fish N Chips I have ever had.  The fish is lightly battered and produces an amazing crunch with every bite.  The batter is lightly flavored so the cod is not overpowered.  Obviously this is deep fried but its not greasy at all.  As far as the chips are concerned, they are similar in size and shape to steak fries.  They have a good crunch to them but also had a meaty and chewy interior.  Oddly enough, when I ate the larger fries they reminded me of a plantain or sweet potato fries.  The fries were good as well.  A little different but definitely good. Tourist Tips:1.  There is a sit down price (10 pounds for the small) and a take away price (7 pounds for the small).2.  If you see that the place is packed, don't be discouraged there is additional seating downstairs3.  The place does accept credit cards but requires a minimum charge of 5 pounds.4.  If you order a coke, they will bring a glass with no ice.

-ozCbphMOe-7DvxXl6AP2g.text: Scoured Yelp, TripAdvisor and the such for the best fish and chips London had to offer. After multiple searches and hours (okay minutes) spent looking, the hubby and I decided upon Rock and Sole... Let me tell you, it did not disappoint! We went with a regular size order of cod fish and chips and a side of mushy peas. The portion was more than enough in case you're wondering if you should go with the large. The fish was deliciously flaky with a yummy, crispy batter. The fries actually tasted like their original form and the peas were a nice accent.In all, we wish our arteries would allow us to eat like this every night! Would definitely make a return visit on our next trip across the pond!

vqqIdRTPIJLji7PDl614VQ.text: A. I scewed up and ordered a meat pie...ughB. I did taste the 'skate' platter and it was fried fish heavenC. Sharing the table with these dang american tourists was a hassle, but struggling over who gets the vinegar was entertainingD. Wait staff was quickE. Price was not over-the-topF. Eating outside under a leaf-shedding tree was also a messI will hit again, I'm 50% sure of it.

VsR07L2ltutJ6CvVETuv_A.text: Proper chippy with a wide selection of fish to choose from.  Fish pies were so-so.  If you can get pass the corny decor (especially in the downstairs dining area) you'll have a nice meal.

qRVRJ3VEPCtrVNaTgDIMLA.text: I have to admit that I did not have high expectation for this place as it's in the middle of the touristy area, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had a cod and chips. The batter was thin and crisp, the fish was moist. And their tartar sauce! It was very tasty, I had to put a spoonful on every bite. Service was fast too.I noticed there were a lot of Asian customers. Maybe that was an indication this place offered good food? JKIf you are a tourist and you want to get good fish and chips, this is the place.

K__GSEiBQNgUCo02rKCzCA.text: Fish and chips is generally not my thing but its London's thing.  So when in London...We ordered the Regular size fish and chips (cod).  More than enough for one person.  Its essential to order cod as your fish b/c its a native atlantic ocean cold water fish.  The batter was perfectly crispy.  They use peanut oil to get that crispyness (and you can tell they change the oil on the regular).  The chips were fresh cut potatoes not something out of a frozen bag.  Its essential to use the tartar sauce on the fish.  I normally shy away from this stuff because of its odd taste, but their sauce was delectable.  Be sure to pair this with a fizzy pilser.  I have never been more happy to sit in 0C temperatures and flurries!

1PR52BEBcpq63TA_78h_3A.text: London has everything. Well, almost, minus a lot of familiar American labels. However, the benefits of going to a country which speaks English (I'll go into British-speak and its differences a little later), are that it's relatively easy to get around, even if you are a chronic directionally-challenged tourist, and the convenience of already being assimilated into a Westernized country. There are a billion cultural differences, and I will attempt to give a glimpse into what I see via words.Today marks the three weeks that I have been here, but I believe that I have hit both the local and the touristy scenes. Because of my internship, I have "assimilated" into being a Brit, somewhat. My supervisor is from Liverpool, and most likely the funniest girl I have met in my life. She is so full of life (increased by her heavy accent), and ready to embark on the world. The other young interns have given me fantastic advice about where to find great nightlife, and mostly, a rounded perspective on Brit vs California life. Hence, many conversations over door-to-door campaigning (in other words, freezing our asses off and walking up and down three blocks), pizza, exploring food on Sheen Lane, and moving offices.ANYWAY, to start off, FOOD. All sorts of restaurants and small eateries in the last few weeks, I can FEEL the dire need to hit the gym soon, before my Asian-girl metabolism cannot handle it anymore.Apparently, tonight I went to one of the best fish and chips restaurants in London, Rock and Sole Pliace, located in Covent Gardens off of Endell Street. This hole in the wall restaurant did have delicious fish and chips (but I still think nothing could compare to Old Street Kebab). Lucky for MD and me, we shared a large cod and chips (11GBP), and they gave us two fairly large fish (yay!). It filled us up right quick, and I'm ALWAYS down for anything fried! There was tartar sauce and ketchup in pots to your own liking on the table, with vinegar too, which was probably the most amazing thing ever because I absolutely love tartar sauce (as awful as it is for you!). The fish was crispy and succulent in exactly the right place, but not too greasy. Fries were chewy, and steak-cut. Not my most FAVORITE chips, and just lukewarm though.The interior design of the restaurant was quirky-- upstairs was a typical take-out area with a few seating areas, but walking down, you sort of descend into an underwater aquarium.Malt vinegar came in a box, LOVED that when I found it.

aIaFxdFHmsPZ9Xo3yy7W1Q.text: Awesome Fish'n Chips, very good quality! Fresh and firm fish, cooked perfectly tender and juicy. Yum. And the chips are thickly cut and just the way they're supposed to be. Awesome stuff for a place in away from the coast and found in a tourist guide. It's not comfortable though and a bit pricey, but if you want a taste of the real Fish'n Chips stop by here!

8yB3EeVPwCph5p7VzglONQ.text: Yes a little touristy, but locals were there too.  Awesome Hummus, good wine and we each got a different fish which was very tasty!

2UN34rio68Mb9dkri1cocg.text: want fish and chips in london - this is your place. I'm personally just a fan of the fat chips, but my friends and family tell me the fish is pretty good. it gets v busy so be prepaired to wait for a table, although I quiet liked the tip that you can go downstairs (looks like your going behind the counter), thats assuming you don't want to set outside and listen to the sights and sometimes smells of covent garden

gN8kNRkgiRSYvR8f3nDRDA.text: This is one of the best fish and chips place I've been to in London but it comes with the price! My boyfriend took me to this "so-called" best fish & chips place which I have my doubts just because I haven't been to a good chippy before. When I saw the price of it, my eyes popped out! I was so shocked but when I bit into it, I realised why it was priced at a higher price than the rest of the chippies... but this still doesn't mean they have the rights to because fish & chips is suppose to be a cheap & cherrful food :)Love the outdoor seatings. Love the fact there's a good chippie in Central London. I had a great experience and would go back... if I really want to treat myself!

qk5vV_FcW7FIpsr7sCXauQ.text: Recommended by a friend that lived in London for a while.  A bit touristy, but does not disappoint.  Waiters seem to speak a lot of different languages.  To sit there when it is cold I suggest upstairs, the basement is odd and painted like an aquarium...  I had the haddock fish and chips and my husband had the cod.  Both were very good, classic, not too oily and very crunchy.  The chips were not great, but overall the experience was enjoyable.  If you're looking for one place to try fish and chips in London, we were pretty happy with this decision.

lO_aegiJTUnF-yk5j199Dw.text: One of my favorite fish and chips places in London. A friend who lived their suggested it and boy was i happy to go. There fish is really tasty.Luckily when i went with a group of friends one day the place wasn't overly crowded and we sat inside. But, it doesn't have many seats.I try to eat healthy, so i try don't to have to many fried things But, if your going to have a fish and chips this is a good go to place.

k-ESPUCrEmnZ-2NqwadP_g.text: After hearing that Rock & Sole Plaice was one of the oldest and best fish & chips places in London, a group of us decided to head over to Covent Garden and lose our British fish & chips virginity together.The place was pretty busy for a Sunday night, but we were lucky enough to be seated within 20 minutes, despite the place being absurdly cramped. My friend and I shared a cod with chips. It was pretty amazing -- the fish was huge and perfectly cooked, the batter wasn't overly greasy or tasteless, and I actually liked the chips, though not everyone in my group did. The tartar sauce and malt vinegar were amazing. They went perfectly with the fish. The fish and chips alone were £10, so it was a pretty pricey meal, but if you're not starving, definitely share with someone else -- the portions were huge.

Nu8j_weU7H33r26cFMHoVA.text: The fish had a nice crisp coating, but the fish itself was exactly the wrong texture - with that overcooked, "squeaky" quality that one encounters far too often.  But the worst part was the chips; dry and mealy, verging on inedible.  And the price was over-the-top ridiculous!  Next time I'll return to the great fish/kebabs place a bit south of St. Pancras (Star?) that has become my Gold Standard thus far - twice as good, at less than half the price of Rock and Sole.  You've been warned.

rCmDptj4I-A-F-V8okrS7w.text: The 'Rock & Sole Plaice' is supposedly London's oldest surviving Fish & Chip shop after being established in 1871. The painted sign in the window reads established 1874; on the menu it says 1871. Est. 1949 says the contradictory receipt. In fact, owner Hassan Ziyaeddin moved to London in 1960, and we could find nothing to substantiate his claim to be Londons oldest surviving fish and chip restaurant. The fish & chip shop is located on a corner, it's fairly small and fairly cramped. I guess there must be about six to nine tables on the ground floor. Opposite the tables you will find the counter where customers can collect and take away. There's the option to dine upstairs in amongst the hustle and bustle of the takeaway service or to venture downstairs to the other calmer restaurant area. Classic cod and chips is the star of the menu but more adventurous options include tuna and Dover sole. I don't eat fish and coming from a port would never trust London fish but I am told it is good. The chips are fine Chunky chips and it's all cooked in peanut oil, which makes it a marginally healthier option than usual. It has had some bad reviews elsewhere (and good ones) so maybe a veggie is not the right person to review it.

Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

dzEK53Dy5fZ9lSI3tU040A.text: Good fish and chips.  Seating is interesting... we kept thinking a wayward cabbie would take us out.  They have a good selection of types of fish to use in your fish and chips.  Peas are quite good.  Nice beers.

TUFkMoEWRFvcVj9h8lByQQ.text: Fissssssh cakes please!This place has changed a little since I first went 4 years ago and when I worked close it was a Friday lunch favourite. If you don't have a big appetite this place is not worth the money though, at £10 per portion that better be a damn posh bit of fish. A while ago this place had some fantastic chinese lanterns outside which made it a really romantic place to eat but I haven't seen them up in a while. What is good about this place though is the fact that even though it's not the original owners (this is the oldest fish and chip shop in London you know?! - jellied eels anyone) the current owners use all the old passed down traditional recipes. Mushy peas are as good as mine, the fish cakes are beautiful (NB only order one they are HUGE) and the tartar sauce is homemade. Mmmmm.... I know what I want for tea now!

xCxa5O2Umpnmls8L4Cv4nw.text: I had the haddock and chips with a side of mushy peas. The mushy peas were about as tasty as they sound by the name. You get what you ask for. More importantly, the haddock and chips were delicious. The regular size plate was on the expensive side, but it was also a very large portion. The service was incredibly fast (though it was during the mid afternoon lull). It's a small restaurant, but there's a decent amount of outdoor seating.

uTe-lNJOYHGrKjIn51NiwQ.text: I never write reviews, but I had to for this. Amazing light, crispy fish & fresh chips. Go!

zxMVa37Wg4k6nagS5KCGGw.text: What a great find! We were walking from Covent Garden to the Shaftesbury Theatre for Motown the Musical and stumbled across this little gem. NOTE there are many more tables than meets the eye when you walk in, and don't be distracted by all the people getting takeaway meals - they have table service and a full bar.Mrs G ordered plaice and chips whereas I had rock fish. We both loved our meals and the service was great. For my American friends - try rock fish when you see it over here in the UK. Delicious and last night was no exception - their oil is very fresh and the fish too! Yummy!! Rock fish is any small shark that they catch off the coast of the UK. Hence - none of the annoying small bones in all other fish. It has a flaky but slightly meaty consistency, white and a wonderful delicate flavor - in my case souses in malt vinegar the way we Brits love it.Yes we will be back soon!!

rXyAMobqdhaZhSer5PKHxw.text: One of the many restaurants in Covent Garden but certainly not with the best fish and chips you can find. Haddock was our choice of fish after our server said it's similar to a cod. It was flaky and moist enough with a subtle crisp golden breading. A regular for £14.50 is plenty for one person which is a good thing considering the price tag but I was so disappointed with the chips being soggy. I also thought the Beef and Onion Pie (£7.50) was just decent and forgettable. Maybe they can do better with dessert? We ordered Banana Fritters (£4) to share and when asked if we wanted it with ice cream, we couldn't say no. I thought she meant "a la mode" but instead, we were given a whole bowl of grocery-bought ice cream with 4 mini scoops on the side. The annoying part? We got the bill and was charged extra (£5) for it. Ugh. I hate servers who up-sell. What's worse, she even added an automatic 10% service fee. Wow. And no free Wi-Fi in this tourist trap.

OB5yhKO0fXOt2Uzrcxx9QA.text: We stopped by to have an early dinner before we hit the theater to see Kinky Boots.  We were in the area and this is one of the oldest fish and chip establishments in London.  We were seated right away outside since we beat the evening rush and promptly ordered the lemon sole, haddock, cod and mushy peas.  My friends and I enjoyed the fish and the serving sizes are large.  We didn't finish everything but enjoyed the chips as well as the mushy peas.  We would plan another visit the next time we're in town. Great service.

whywuaQVOvjX3AYVB6Lmdg.text: This place made me like fish & chips Cod and haddock. The haddock is the better one for me but this place is a must try.

Zn2VXYny44CiD2l3fO2EaQ.text: Enjoyed both the cod & the prawns. Tartar is quite good with heavy dill, Fries/chips were favorable as well, compared to others we had on this trip.Best part was our server -- kept us laughing and took care of a kitchen mixup w/ extra fish.The breading wasn't like OMG-slap-somebody good but the simplicity of the place & menu would bring me back.

DDV52uS-hcHkYXzQrtXqvA.text: Fish and chips: I haven't eaten it a ton so take my review with a grain of salt. Rock & Sole is a pretty small whole in the wall with some outdoor seating. What's interesting is that their sit down menu is significantly more expensive than take out. For reference, the cod for take out was $11 GBP whereas the sit down was $15.50. That's close to  50 percent higher which is insane. Being the cheap ass that I am, I made the executive call to get it to go. We ended up with the cod, haddock and a regular fries. Everything tasted great but I found it weird that there was no tartar sauce! Is that an America thing? You live and you learn, I guess.

c5mYBV-QJzqqaJbW7uHSZQ.text: A sign on the wall inside by the counter notes they've been making fish & chips for 140 years, setting my expectations high! I stumbled in around 7pm after an incredibly long travel day. I asked for table service (as you do in the U.K.,) and was immediately guided to a table. Food: I asked for the large haddock meal with chips, and was told they were out, but had the regular size, which I went with. I was curious how big a large fish was going to be :-) The plate that arrived was more than enough for one. The fish was fresh and cooked perfectly, with a crunchy and crisp batter. It's deep fried, so expect a little grease, which was minimal considering. Chips were not as crispy as the fish, but decent. Tartar sauce comes on the side in a little plastic container. It was delicious, but the portion could be bigger considering the size of fish. There are mayo and tomato sauce packets provided on the table. Service: Efficient, and they turn tables quickly. The fish was served within a few minutes, and the drink showed up a few moments later. Cost: Bit on the high side, but it's central London. A regular haddock and Fanta Orange ran me £19.50. Table service does cost about £2 more than take out. Overall: Fresh and well cooked fish. Lots of seating, even for the solo traveler. Restrooms for customers only.

0GeJ19I3NDqUo_FhgTwKsA.text: Just left there right now to grab some fish and chips. I didn't know I can't sit there if I take food to go. For some reason, you can't eat there if you take food to go. BooooooAlso, I wanted to order skate fish and they didn't have any cooked. Told me 15 mins or so. So of course, I said give me what you got.

RAijuWx78twsxMbwrOZGGQ.text: Great and fast service. Excellent fish and chips. Make sure to order mushy peas and a bread roll and make a sandwich with Bread, butter, mushy peas, chips, and pepper.

YjbznKhJZRIxqwGcjIeTVQ.text: When I'm London you have to eat fish and chips. This was our first stop in London. My friend and I came in different flights, meet up at a nearby train station and made our way here after checking into the hostel. There were multiple fish and chip spots but this one stood out. We opted for the outdoor seating. It was windy but manageable. We got two types of fish and chips. Fish batter was crispy and seasoned perfectly. The fries were crispy but wasn't the best fries i had. The pickles and pickled onions were a nice touch with the fish and chips. The tarter sauce paired nicely with the fish. Overall it was a decent fish and chips spot. You can smell the fryer from outside. I would come back after trying other fish and chips spots first.
