JVt3-7LTzzxwnxu96OqYwA.text: The fish was decent, though my chips were soggy.Everything (if you're eating in) is severely overpriced for what you get, though. Worst part is, they have a board up telling you how much everything is to take away. That gives you your entire meal to think about what a sucker you are. Example: regular cod/chips to take away? 8.50. Same thing at one of their tables? 14.50.  Is there anything about the service or table itself that is worth 6 pounds?? No. On service: I asked for a beer. Did not come. When my food came, I asked for it again, and they waited until I was almost finished with my meal before bringing it out. On the table: it's really just a normal table. And then they add an additional 10% for service when you're already paying almost 2X for the privilege of their service!Net: get your fish and chips elsewhere. Many many other options within 5 minutes walk.

v2TtHABdmNc6WOovBMN7Yg.text: We shared the party platter for two that came with cod, haddock, chips (fries), and mushy peas. Cod and haddock were great! Really fresh and, while fried, not very greasy. Mushy peas aren't my jam but they tasted okay. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod, Haddock, and Chips Plate
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Mushy Peas

he99jyvNMPelpmlw-pm7kg.text: Again, another top notch experience at the R&SP. Excellent fish n' chips (I had haddock, wife had Skate). Love coming here and sitting outside!!

f0hXcEW0VvXhBarIzQBvjg.text: Came here because of the good reviews. Ordered the classic fish and chips with a side of mushy peas. The dish itself was great and very delicious. But the price is seriously way too high. If we wouldn't have been so hungry from the flight, I think I would have chosen another place to eat. Our waiter was nice but they were not very attentive. And some of the waiters didn't look very motivated.. All in all was the food good but wouldn't return again as it was way too pricey!

_VJg-hb2ruirDR9JYPkrbw.text: My first stop in London was for some Fish and Chips!Small little fish shop. A few tables. Not crowded but this location is popular with locals and tourist.Service was good. Food is made to order.Large Cod Loin - 16.50 GBP - Huge piece of cod fried to perfection. Moist flakey meat. Batter was thick and crispy. Great alone, with vinegar, and with the tartare sauce. Comes with chips which were nothing special, soggy (I like soggy though), and a bit bland. Caution, fish comes out pipping hot!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod Loin - 16.50 GBP
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod Loin - 16.50 GBP

swit2gn1aGPN2tjbNO5VbA.text: .Amazing food & more importantly amazing people. This is a true hidden pearl which has been around for 145 years.Place is cosy & classical. It's a must stop for a London trip & in the entertainment district.

7JRtC4Vhg2WwN3Gn6dR3Hg.text: Lacks flavor and service needs much improvement.  Definitely not worth anybodys time or money.  Im so glad we only ordered one meal to share since we were still pretty full from lunch.

3Tz91MZyfCiOATgbAaaD5g.text: Classic fish and chips.  Service is fast.  Great tartar sauce.  Just walked in and said "what's the best fish?"   Answer was Cod.  Grabbed some mushy peas to finish off the classic (and some Cole slaw).  Just so solid.  Place looks like it's decorated with subway tile.  Just classic look and feel and taste.  All awesome.  Down to the Heinz ketchup.

Y9Nmap2JB5YOnN_5AzyDMw.text: Yeah, if you go to Rock and Sole and don't get fish & chips, you should be deported. We have had a lot of fish & chips in our 2 weeks in London, and I don't think had a BIGGER piece of fish (cod) than anywhere else.  The place is big and bustling, and you pretty much have to eat outside, which sucks when it rains. But a very good meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

wNMb0Qlm8QN16ZSEc0Zw8w.text: Portions are enormous! We ordered the reg portions Haddock and lemon sole, omg there portions are very very generous. My advice share a plate if you are not that hungry.  The prawn and garlic twist was also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Reg Haddock & Chips
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

UGFmHDIhYgUhd-mBHxaAeQ.text: Yo, I'm no fish and chip expert and I guess this was lightly battered and everything but frankly I think fatty dirty oil might have given the fish more flavor.  It is a tourist place and the slightly more expensive than every other place b/c apparently "fish & chip" is offered EVERYWHERE!  Mushy peas... I just don't get it.  It's like baby food but with even less flavor.  Yo, I'll take Gerber.Hopefully, I'm not offending any Londoners but fish and chip is a once a year kind of thing for me.  Give me McD's filet-o-fish any day.

T8oz6QDF-GLvFNjr9whFIg.text: The service was really miserable and we left thirsty because we couldn't get anyone's attention for a refill on our water! But the fish was very fresh and a nice big portion--a completely different dish from when we've had it at pubs. The boyf and I split a large plate of cod with chips and mushy peas and were both happy with the amount of food.They have an underwater mural downstairs, but the best place to sit is probably outside--they have those pretty outdoor heaters with a visible flame.Casual, cozy, and verrrrry popular.

6lK87Btu3ZtXLFthsEHW0A.text: I'd avoided this place after living in the area for a year and working in the area for another year. Why? Because it seemed to be the fish 'n' chip shop of tourists. I imagine it's made its way into some tourist guide, so visitors from America, Canada, Japan, etc all come here for their 'authentic British fish 'n' chip' experience.And I wasn't going to fall for that.But I did last Saturday.And it was good. A bit expensive, but the portions are massive and come with chips. Importantly, the batter is pretty tasty. And it's one of the few chippies that has a sit-in area you actually don't mind sitting in all that much.Tourists and locals alike could do much worse.It's certainly one of the better fish 'n' chip shops I've been to in London.(For the record, I'd choose Rock & Sole Plaice a million times over the Golden Hind. yelp.co.uk/biz/the-golde…)

69XAESfhpqFlMf1FHTC7JA.text: Expensive but nice quality fish, the portions are good though and quite filling. Seating is split between indoors (upper and a lower floor) and outdoors. You can be asked to share a table though during busy times.

YGR4VDPrniZsmtLNfAWwZA.text: We came here for the fish and chips and they did not disappoint. It is a small place with outside dining options (the only option i recommend), but worth the visit!

2mFrILQ8Qr7yAJCbCYVk-Q.text: Meh - this one is ok, but not somewhere I'd probably go back to.  You get lots of food, but my chips were cold and the fish was nice, but not amazing.  Perhaps an off day, but at the prices, I was expecting more.  Big portions though, I will give them that.

R23SC7bQ4LEOjsPUpEpeRA.text: The phrase 'cheap as chips' probably doesn't apply here, as these are serious West End prices, but the quality of the chips cannot be denied. The crunchiest (yet fluffiest!) chips you're likely to try in a long time, they are well worth having at least ones. The 'place' itself is set in a smallish old-fashioned cafe/diner style shopfront, but during the summer you can sit out on the pavement in roomy park-bench style seats beneath pleasantly twisting vines. You can smell the scent of fish and chips frying all the way up Endell Street, and I always find it highly tempting!

5z60eoSdtvQddDfS_qSqXQ.text: Not the best not the worse.  My wife and I shared a piece of cod and had some chips with it.  The fish was prepared well, flavorful, tender.  As nice as the fish was the chips were on the other end of the spectrum.  They were tough, yet soggy.  Not a good partner to this pair.   If you come here to eat you should take it to go.  It will cost you about 5 pound more to sit and have the same meal.  go in the street and eat it and you will save quite a bit of money.  worth stopping by, but do not expect to be blown away.

FN0lh0WJMLOHnWyABg24yw.text: So yeah, went here with a craving for some decent fish and chips, and while it didn't suck, it didn't exactly delight.  And make no mistake, this is a FISH AND CHIPS PLACE ONLY.  Small menu with really only options around the type of fish.  Not much variety in drinks or sides even.It's a tiny place with not much seating so that is also a negative.  Honestly I don't need a huge place, but if you have a small place, at least have a staff that is competent enough to turn tables quickly.  While waiting for a seat, we had to watch one table ask 3 times for the bill, and then once they had it, had to wait 10 minutes for them to take the money.  More specifically on the food, it was HUGE portions, even the regular size was big.  The issue I had really was around consistency: 1.) While we all ordered the same fish, some was colder than other, and less crispy.  2.) The Chips were not that great.  Mine were cold while my fish was hot.  But my wifes were hot with her fish colder.3.) Malt Vinegar was weak. 4.) Tartar sauce more a dill based taste more than anything.  That being said, it's not a bad for a stomach filler after a long day of pints.  We went after the Community Shield match and it hit the spot for quantity for price, but just not the best experience that a lot of other reviewers were selling me on.

sIjPCYuuq6xrYVI_fIcNsg.text: Hmm, haven't had fish n chips for...years!  But why did I drag my wifey to eat here?  Hey, we're in London!Instead of take-away, we sat down next to other tourists with the same idea.  I must say, the cod was awesome!  So much better than the frozen stuff I remembered having in San Francisco.  Although I don't normally crave fish n chips, I'd come here again after a few pints.

BcYmJYedWNsKbAYXjo4LsQ.text: Damn good fish 'n chips. Service was slow but the place was packed (good sign), so I was willing to let it slide but it was BAD. Be sure to get a table right by the street so you can enjoy your fish as the cars whiz by you at 50 mph. It truly adds to the London experience. Oh, and their bathroom was horrifying. Be sure to sanitize yourself after you go.

USF95xcAhA4F39Q663EyGg.text: I had a long layover in London on my way back to NYC from Edinburgh.  Since I flew into Gatwick but was flying out of Heathrow, I picked up some snacks at Marks & Spencers and settled in on the Gatwick Express to Victoria station.  At Victoria, I decided to make the most of my layover and polled the masses for the best fish and chips in London.  Rock and Soul Plaice emerged victorious, so I headed to Covent Garden.It was a bonus that Rock and Soul Plaice is easy to reach from the tube station (given my luggage).  Also, it was a mild sunny day - ideal for eating outdoors.  After a brief 5 minute wait, I smushed (get your mind out of the gutter, jersey shore fans) in with a family of four at one of the wooden picnic tables out front.  In a completely authoritative and extremely enthusiastic manner, I was commanded to order the cod by the tiny boy next to me.  I bowed to peer pressure and additionally requested extra crispy chips.The platter was quite magnificent.  The huge slab of cod was the best fried cod I've ever had - extremely tender with a miraculous and thrilling crisp!  Crispy like thrice fried Korean fried chicken!  The chips were extra crispy as requested.  Condiments abounded on the table, and the tartar sauce was plentiful and tasty.  The only thing that would have improved the experience was some hot sauce.  That may be more of a southern USA thing.PARTING THOUGHT: This was one of the most productive (and delicious) layovers I've ever had!

ApAdplgjctywViP8KQfD1A.text: Sunday night in search of a placeGoogled fish and chips, ready to stuff my faceRock and Sole Place came highly recommended So I grabbed 10 pounds, and there I'd spend itOrdered cod and chips, served very fast Still hot when I got to my flat, at last Post-salt and vinegar I dug in Grease dripping down my chinny chin chin The cod was decent, though cooked perfectly, a little bland and the batter overzealously applied by someone in the kitchen Chips were thick, they were just okayI'd go back, but would take Fish Bone over RASP any dayThe counter staff was so pleasant, so I have to sayWhen my trusty old standby's closed, I would return straight away

4KumULOanZU-B0CH-teYog.text: Wow, there are a lot of reviews for this place! I heard about this place from a tour guide and they were perfectly right to recommend it. I've loved fish and chips even before moving to the UK and these were truly a notch above most and worth slogging through Covent Garden for. Great fish and equally important... great chips! Good potato flavor and ratio of potato to friedness. Fish is really nice and tender. I didn't find any tiny hidden fish bones. It drives me crazy when I find those because it makes me paranoid I'll choke and die which turns dinner into something kind of stressful... We were too stuffed to finish the mushy peas, but they were quite good. Not too crazy green in color and tasted just like fresh peas.The restaurant is really small. A step above hole in the wall (which I mean in the American English sense of "a kind of dingy, but authentic" place not an ATM!). They're really efficient about the whole thing though.

2e7AYdq-z42Wt62KwlNC7A.text: When I was in London (August 2010), I stayed in Convent Garden and was looking for a place to get some good fish and chips in the area.  I found this place on yelp! and decided to give it a try because the reviews were decent.  BIG mistake.  So I went in with my companion and got an order to go on a busy friday night.  We got a large fish and chips and onion rings to go. They told us that the larger fish wasn't ready yet so it would be about 10 mins.  We decided to wait and placed our order, so they asked if we could wait outside since it was pretty busy and crowded.  There was a constant line of people coming in to order and take away since all of the tables (kind of cafeteria-style, first come, first serve) were full.  You can watch them make the food because of the large window into the open kitchen.  I wish I hadn't.  I watched the same guy who was handling cash, go over and pick up the fish for an order, with his bare fingers and put it on a plate for a customer.  No one was wearing any gloves.  So think about this: the same guy who scratches his butt is using the same hands and skin to pick your food up.  That food will go into your mouth.  I guess I am just used to there being health restrictions and certain ways you handle food.  Anyways, 30 mins later, after reminding them about our order twice, and watching about 20 different people walk in and out with their order, they still hadn't given me my food.  Again, went into remind them and after another 10 mins, I went back to my flat.  Food: not even worth it.  The fish was mediocre at best with a crappy batter.  The chips were even worse.  Not crisp at all.  If you like american onion rings, don't order the ones here.  They're dried out and the batter is gross.  Overall:  horrible food, even more horrible service, terrible hygiene, which makes it a I would rather eat McDonalds than this place.

HU6iKdi3Mn6s7Kn83z3KKQ.text: I recently went to London on a trip and found out about this awesome little place in a guide book that was sent to me.  First off, I LOVE FISH and CHIPS.  I grew up loving and being in the land where they cannot do wrong in making it, I was like a boy in a candy store.I love the fact that it's simple, rustic, and fresh.  The fish is battered nicely in a cornmeal batter.  It's crisp, and light, and isn't heavy at all.  They have a variety of fish and that really appeals to everyone who loves the different textures and tastes of the sea.We ordered the Large Cod as well as a Large Haddock.  By far, the Cod was one of the best that I've ever had.  Each portion came with a healthy mound of thick cut chips and served well to round out the meal.My favorite thing is their tarter sauce, which was nice and light, and had a hint of dill with it.  By far one of the most amazing experiences I have had in eating authentic Fish and Chips.The decor of the place is nice and quant, and very comforting.  It's seated on the corner and we sat near the window, soaking in the sights and life of the British people.  Nothing better.  Love it.

XHqMIsD9qHnn1dc5ivxYEQ.text: Awesome fish & chips.  4 days into my London trip, I was craving fish & chips.  So on a Saturday afternoon, after consulting with Yelp, I found this place.  It was nice to see a Yelp sticker on the door of the place and they welcomed me in.  After some confusion on who I should be ordering from (if you sit at a table you have to order from the waiter) I was presented with a giant plate of fried cod.  The fish was excellent and cooked to perfection.  The fries were of the big steak fry variety and really good.  Nice staff, and better fish.  What more can you ask for on a sunny afternoon?

55LmOxpmexhl9WxgGgd7vg.text: After my trip down the Thames to Richmond I came back to London by train and worked up quite the appetite at the Seven Dials Club drinking a few pints with friends. I confessed to my friend Steve that I have yet to have a great fish and chips meal in London. Steve suggested that we have a nice meal of Fish and Chips at the Rock and Sole Plaice located in Covent Garden which is within walking distance of the Seven Dials; what a great suggestion! Rock and Sole Plaice is a small restaurant offering indoor seating as well as sidewalk seating. The sidewalk seating which is where we ate has tables of 6 so if you are a small party be prepared to have others seated at your table but no worries, I noticed that when strangers were seated together they enjoyed each others conversation and who knows, sharing your meal with a stranger or two could enhance your meal!?We started with an appetizer or "starter" as they say of Hummus and warm pita bread. The Hummus was nice and creamy with a generous pour of olive oil, the pita was very soft and fresh and was the perfect bread to accompany the hummus. My entree was a large serving of Cod that was battered and deep fried and served with home cut fries or "Chips" as they say over here. I have to say that the fish was very fresh and the batter was crunchy and I loved every bit of the meal. The chips were nice and thick, cooked perfectly and with a couple sprinkles of malted vinegar tasted great. We finished the meal with a bottle of house white wine which I think was a nice Pinot GrigioI'd definitely return to the Rock and Sole Plaice.

H5AipVEEvAIHdsAm_GjrXw.text: I'm sure this once used to do great fish and chips. I've not tried it a couple of times over the past 12 months with this memory in mind. But unfortunately on each occasion it really hasn't been great. Thick batter that's hard and seems to have been fried to death. Consequently fish was quite dry.Think if you go for a pie/chips you'll be ok. But there's much better fish places close by.

TRgJHB-jlcXiAoGW7_7kpQ.text: Came here with family on a short London vacation. Not a fancy place at all, casual little restaurant with 6-7 tables. Friendly service. Expensive for the quality/fanciness factor per se (or I'm just not getting used to the hyper expensiveness of everything in London). In terms of fish, when we were there from better to good: Haddock -- Cod --  Halibut. Calamari was also great as appetizer.

gdriv1r3EDqtzm6a3MqsEA.text: I enjoyed my fish and chips from here. The fish seemed fresh and the chips were thick like steak fries. But, the batter was a little thicker than I like, and the prices were VERY high for what you get (we opted for take-out). Had the prices been reasonable, this would be 4 stars.

ky9mC4mV9zh1MX_qP5TsgQ.text: Terrible service if there's any. We were seated at a table for two, which was rather squashed. When we asked if we could switch to a larger table, the waitress put a "Reserved" tag on it. Every party of two around us is sitting at a stable for four.

nMHe9N7wkTLWY1kJLKUmyg.text: A 140 yr old historic chippy right in the middle of Covent Garden. I loved the simplicity of the place. Beautiful large glass windows and neat rectangular tables fill the restaurant inside and out. We chose to sit indoors because london was a bit chilly today (surprise). Two friends were visiting from the states, and they got a proper fish n' chip dinner here at Rock and Sole. The items are a little on the pricier side, but it's only because the seafood is freshly prepared daily and the wait staff are kind and attentive. They're an iconic London fixture and a place you shouldn't miss.

tt33yzVlIJR6SBK3vQsU5Q.text: Enjoyed our first English breakfast before seeing the crown jewels at Tower of London.

AoA1KAZqqRUqe0IaUi1deA.text: The place is for tourists. It is over rated and over priced. The fish and chips was ok, but no better than 80% of the chippies out there. I like the idea of giving people decent tables, serving beer etc with the fish and chips. However it just was not that good. I do not eat fish and chips that much in London. My mrs is not bothered and I  save myself for when I return to my homeland of South Yorkshire (where I know a few lovely places). However I have had better fish and chips in London and for much cheaper. There's a chippy in Earsfield (Wandsworth Town end of Garrat Lane) that was close to where I lived, that is much better. There was no cod ready and the haddock was ok. Chips not bad and mushy pies pretty nice. I quite enjoyed it, but object to having to pay 20 quid for it all. I am sure they will keep pulling the wool over the eyes of American's, Italians, Spaniards and Asian's (that is those that do not know good fish and chips) but if you are English then do not bother. Just simply go to your local chippy. That or try a restaurant.

xt1rdTkm0n6PQ9FmtDS1xQ.text: In my American opinion the Cod Fish and Chips was excellent!  Not a fancy place, but prompt, attentive service and several types of fish to choose from.  Would definitely come back if I'm ever in the neighborhood.

HBchPaubKbwMS84JwiHj0g.text: Wow-some really tasty fish and chips! Fantastically fresh, succulent cod and wonderfully chunky chips! Not much space inside but there's a lovely little terrace area outside. It's a bit on the tourist trail so always full but well worth the wait!My only quibble would be the price. £13.50 for cod and chips-really guys? That's well beyond any other "posh" fish and chips place I've come across. I suppose the tourists will pay it but I certainly won't be running back there at those prices!c*

AGgiyISzXOHS5__mcjVEZg.text: Yikes, sticker shock at the eat in price! 15 - 18 pounds for an order of fish and chips. Besides the price the fish is very good. I got the Cod and others at the table got Haddock and Rock. I think the Cod was the best. It was light and flakey with a delicate flavor. Also all the fish was fried to perfection. The batter was not overly thick or greasy, probably some of the best fried fish I've had. Tartar sauce was also good with fresh dill in it. The chips were just average at best. They were thick but some tasted a little raw and some were overly cooked. If rating on just the fish alone I would give it 5 stars, but taking in price and the ok chips, I can only give 3.

tiRplyV5WdCz3EUdGww6Kw.text: Outstanding!  If you visit London and don't have fish and chips here you are crazy. A little pricey, yes but beautifully done. The whole Cod was lightly battered and fried to perfection. It was so good we came back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Yummy Cod with chips.

uvfppjpRCw_-thgl5Q4JPA.text: The BEST fish & chips I have ever had, or ever will have, in my life. Bar none.Yes, it's a little bit more expensive than the cheap places on the street, but you definitely get what you pay for. I mean, they have been in business there since 1871! If that alone doesn't make you a believer, get the fried cod, rock, or haddock and chips (thick cut steak-fry style deliciousness), douse it with some lemon and malt vinegar, and let these fried pieces of heaven melt in your mouth for the best chippy experience in the world! They even serve it to-go in a neat newspaper cone to take for the road for a little stroll to nearby Covent Gardens or Leicester Square. This place was so amazing after my first time that I came back twice in my next 3-day trip to London, and it will be my first stop upon my next return!

9u_pcbBuwd0jEj-ZWzB8Jg.text: I am from Montreal and went there with a friend while we were visiting London. The fish and chips are just amazing. Sadly, in Montreal, i didn't find nothing  as good as this so i miss it a lot. The oil they use to cook the fish and chips is light and doesn't taste like old oil. The batter is crunchy and light with a nice golden colour. They have many choices of fishes and seafoods. The fish we had was very fresh. They also have side dishes that looked good but we didn't order those. The server was very nice and chatty. I hope i'll have the chance to go back there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

10IaH8qahkAoxRFhQmPZFA.text: Perhaps someone in the whole Yelp community should mention in their reviews how this is the most pricey fish&chips in London. £15 for a regular portion, £18 for a large one (this if you're dining in). I leave any other consideration with you.

rFJYH1Cp10PewvWKT4jzEA.text: Really delicious fish and chips. We did not feel rushed, but the service was prompt. It is pricey, but the fish was very fresh and the tartar sauce was delicious

_lKC2a1g2Q2L6ta3H7xkPw.text: This was my first meal in London based on a recommendation & let me just say it was AWESOME. Even with the weather being dreary (but hey, it was London after all) the tables on the side walk were packed. We sat next to a really nice couple who chatted us up about the "must see" sites in town. Ask for the onion vinegar and a cold beer and you are good to go. Nothing fancy just kick-ass fish & chips!!

RPUnh4WWNMh9BXQtPGzL4Q.text: I came here and got the cod and chips, which was good, but not fantastic. The prices were astronomical, however, with one cod and chips running a steep £15. The tartar sauce, however, was exceptional and the server was quite attentive.Overall I would take a pass on coming here. There are comparable fish and chip places within walking distance (less than a mile) that offer equivalent food for less than half the price.

AOZV7zEPKis9JipYvhGBYg.text: Ugh! This place! This was my first meal in London. I made the mistake of ordering the large which was WAY too much delicious food even more my belly which I try to stretch as often as possible...Fried to perfection and the perfect compliment to my cool beer. I enjoyed a lovely afternoon here. The service is prompt and friendly but not over attentive.Thank you Rock & Sole for welcoming a li'l American girl to London!

JZMtO-15S10Y4PDNn8XBJA.text: I've been dying to go to Rock & Sole Plaice for years and then I finally made it there the other week and ended up going twice in one week, well actually in the space of two days! :-s I do love fish and chips but this wasn't intentional, however it wasn't a bad thing (though my waistline might say differently!) On the first occasion, when I went with my Mum we both ordered the regular cod and chips and we could've easily shared one portion between us! The mushy peas were okay but what was amazing was the tartare sauce, it was simply beautiful! We also shared a bottle of Merlot which was delicious too and a snip at only £14.When I returned two days later, I had cod roe which was amazing too. Unfortunately this time my friend and I chanced a glass of the house red as we were in a rush, and it was horrid - like cheap vinegar! In a great Covent Garden location and now a bit of a tourist trap, but still attracting locals and self-respecting Londoners alike, it's worth a visit - just make sure you go armed with an appetite! Enjoy!

X_hAXuw37TW58ekeHSDYlQ.text: Back in 2006...Me to Shopkeeper at the St Martin-in-the-Fields: Hi Ms., can you recommend me some restaurants where I can find some good ol' English cuisine? Especially a place that serves British staple food like fish and chips.Shopkeeper: Oh, you don't want to eat English food. It's not very good. You should go try Indian or Chinese. They're very good and you can find any restaurant here that serves good Chinese and Indian.Me: -_____-"So what happened to my 2006 British food adventure? Had some terrible pizza, whatever sandwiches and salads.. Oh, I did take up her suggestion and tried some Chinese. She was right, the Chinese was not bad here.After much discouragement back in 2006, I decided this time around I'd just go with my gut and find some good ol' English food. Rock & Sole Plaice was the first stop of my British food tour redux. It was conveniently located in the hip, Covent Garden, within the proximity of my hostel, and with a name like that, I had to give it a try!My fiance and I had to wait a bit since this place was extremely crowded, even during the late hours. The establishment claims that they were the very first to serve, or was it invent fish and chips? Anyway, once we finally got seated out in their patio, we ordered their popular dish, cod and chips. The plate came piping hot with 2 generous sized cod fish (I'd say each piece was a half of the cod fish) and wedges of potatoes. The cod was lightly battered, crispy golden brown, and not greasy. Very delish! All-in-all, a great recovery from my last trip. I definitely recommend Rock & Sole Plaice for some good ol' fashion British fish and chips.Food: British classicAmbiance: al fresco in Rainy London

oQfRps8HCqb5qpVlyjmxFg.text: Thank heavens for mushy peas! Our party of 5 heard nothing, but rave reviews about this spot, which made us very eager to check it out. When we arrived the restaurant was extremely crowded! We thought that was a good sign. We made our way in and told the staff behind the counter that there were 5 of us. She quickly directed us to come to her. She led us through the kitchen and down the stairs. To an overly cramped lower level. The tables were pushed so tightly together we could not even access the three chairs against the wall. In order for each of us to have a seat we needed those chairs. We separated our table, two of us squeezed in and then pushed the table back together. We were left with our menus and began to determine our choice of fish. It wasn't a very large menu, so we were shocked when it took forever for anyone to check back with us or even take our drink order. When the server appeared we felt we better get it all in at once. An order of calamari, one order of mushy peas, 5 Efes Pilsener, 3 Cod and 2 Halibut. Our food arrived and we dug right in. Unfortunately, either our taste buds are off or we did not receive the same glorious fish and chips everyone else raves about. It was nothing special. The chips were soggy and cold, not a good combination. We had finished picking at the tasteless meal and were ready to go. We hadn't seen our server since he delivered our meal. After waiting for what seemed like an eternity we decide to head upstairs and hunt our check down ourselves. People are pouring in and out. All 5 of us are standing there trying to pay our check. It was so ridiculous. Seriously? Do you want our money or not? Well, you got it this time, but I can assure you there won't be a next.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

s4S9sKYVrGRQalKgGitDcQ.text: My first and only fish and chips experience. Fish (Cod) was moist and crispy (they were out of haddock), Calamari was ok, chips (the fries) were a little soggy. The tartar sauce was awesome though. Most definitely try out their tartar sauce. There's extra seating in the basement which is laid out better and looks nicer than the main floor( plus there's no cold drAft when the door opens. You can take out and pay less. The bathroom is downstairs.

LjJyClqahAMxRUFafXA91g.text: Very good fish and chips. As a Canadian visiting this place kept coming up and it fit what I wanted... service was super quick and everything was what I wanted.... Yum!

NPGdXIRPomjgzK2CI-rxGw.text: All I wanted to eat in London was fish and chips and I searched Yelp for "the best" and in between stops at pubs, some rocking fish and chips would surely hit the spot.  We sought out Rock and Sole Plaice and this "no frills" fish and chips place dates back to 1871 and serves fish of your choice fried up with chips and other offered sides if you choose.  Portions are pretty big and cheaper to order to go but given that it was a cold november night, boyfriend and I opted to dine in, ordered a large cod fish and chips to share along with beers and tea for me.  Service was friendly, efficient and unobtrusive. Our cod was fresh and fried perfectly golden and crispy on the outside, moist and flaky on the inside and not too heavy and greasy at all accompanied by lemon and tartar sauce and accompanied chips were tasty as well.  I wanted to try their famed mushy peas but was too full, next time!Joanna's mission to eat some good fish and chips accomplished!

16zahKIJ8O1IhTErH0QocA.text: One thing I had to eat this time while visiting London was some fish and chips.  I think it's compulsory for all tourists.  I rarely eat it at home whenever I go to pubs though which is strange because I love fish, fried stuff, and fries.  Ordered the cod fish with chips.  It was pretty good and a pretty massive serving.  I couldn't finish everything.  The battered exterior was quite crispy and the fish was flaky and moist though not as moist and tender as I would have hoped.  I am by no means a fish and chips aficionado, but I may just start ordering it a little more often if I find myself at pubs and the like around home.

gHaThLUc79D0juz2biIhTQ.text: If you're in London and going to get fish n chips, Rock & Sole is an absolute MUST.  They have the best tasting stuff around.  If you don't feel like paying extra, get it carry-out, but sitting down gives you a much-needed relief from walking around the city.I've been here three times so far.  The first time, the cod was cooked perfectly, but the chips were soggy.  I gave them the benefit of the doubt though - it was closing time, and our chips were probably sitting there for a few minutes before they hit the carry-out box.  Still, everything was super-flavourful, so I was more than happy to return.The second trip was PERFECT in every way.  Perfectly cooked fish, perfectly cooked chips, perfect seasoning, perfect sauces (okay, those don't change much, but that tartar sauce - wow).  If it were like this all the time, this place would be 5 stars, hands-down.  However, my THIRD trip left us with an overcooked piece of cod.  It was just too dry.  I pointed it out to the waiter - wasn't expecting anything in return, I just wanted to let them know that it wasn't up to par.  The waiter just shrugged.  No bueno.Still, I would highly highly recommend this joint to anyone visiting, stopping by, or living in London.  Absolutely loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod n chips
Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Calimari

uKwDl6wZ4LMvruiNHDhgQA.text: After a lovely showing of Matilda at the Cambridge theater, I had a great meal at Rock & Sole. Though I'm not a connoisseur of fish and chips, I did thoroughly enjoy my meal. I had the regular sized-cod with mushy peas and curry sauce. The fish was moist and a good sized portion, like others have said, the tartar sauce really is the best part -- I just wish they served it in gallon-sized portions rather than the tiny little plastic cups they used (I briefly considered licking the dish but opted not to). The chips were solid wedges, hot and crispy. The curry sauce had a nice, slightly sweet/smoky flavor to it that was nice as well.  My only qualm, as others have mentioned, was the rather high cost -- an average sized plat of fish and chips (nothing added) was 18+ pounds. Like the good tourist I am, I took the price in stride and decided to complain on yelp several days later.

xgAOMJ1TrTJ9DEQeeQiU_g.text: I loved this place. The service was great and the chicken nuggets, cod, and chips were delicious. The plates were pretty large as well. Definitely couldn't finish all the chips on my own. Sincerely,American Tourist

uiQegTWLN7d0GCxzrEaP6w.text: Those saying this fish isn't wonderful are being contrary to look cool because it is WONDERFUL. Crispy, light crust and fresh cod and perfect tartar!Best fish and chips I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. Cod and the best tartar ever!

srSlmUHq5qDdxdjXr-MlFQ.text: The fish here is delicious. We tried the battered cod and lemon sole. I preferred the cod but the lemon sole had good flavor. The fish portions were generous and very moist with a nice consistency and crisp batter. I was very disappointed with the fries which were soggy and stale. Prepare to share your table with randoms on the park bench seating outside.

Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

Vbh6KtXwQbzfQU6H6ujFwA.text: Fast, almost aggressive service. Bland fish that tastes only of the oil it is cooked in. Adequate chunky chips (perhaps a bit soggy). Uncomfortable hard wooden seats. The dwell time for customers must be about 10 minutes tops, with seating about 10 - 12 people, this place must be a goldmine, as a coke, small cod and chips costs a staggering £17! And the food is not good. I ate there this evening, sitting at a barely vacated place, which was quickly cleaned with a cloth that left the table looking like a house in a monsoon. The food arrived immediately, and the paper napkin wrapped knife and fork squelched down on the dripping surface. Lifting the cutlery out of the moisture, I took out a paper towel to swab the table down, and one of the waiters tried to throw the towel away before I'd swabbed the deck properly.I've eaten there before, after a few drinks and my dim memory suggested it was OK, but unless you are pissed, rich and have had your tastebuds surgically removed, I suggest you avoid it.

mMkf8FfDpLA3ypZq-VJG5A.text: This is a great place to bring friends from out of town who want traditional fish & chips in London. Go during the summer because they have outdoor seating and it's nicer to sit outside than in their small and crowded basement. Share if you can't eat a lot because the servings are huge and deep-fried, and definitely ask for extra sauce because their little cups are too small compared to the fish portions. Cozy place with friendly service... I can't wait for more friends to come visit me because I can swing by this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom

V0AN1gFyGOj1K0R05v_jXQ.text: I've been to this place on every trip I've made to London.  It's a pretty good fish and chips joint.  If it happens to be the only fish and chips you eat on your stay here, you will be satisfied.  It's good, not that expensive, and not at all flashy.I recently spent two weeks in England and had fish and chips four times.  Each time was better than the previous.  Rock and Sole was the fourth best.  Their batter just wasn't as delicate, the fish not as firm and flavorful, and the chips not as ...chiptastic as the other places I visited, which were mostly pubs outside of London.

_iXQ44VqYmz-DjuRKzBZeQ.text: Got a nice little table outside on a sunny day, delicious fish and chips and a good local vibe... only thing I would say is eating outside isn't ideal given the busy street its on, but overall the food was good and the service was quick which was just what we needed for a quick lunch time meal..

PfqOqS47RD9NnDijfZhr5w.text: These were good but I had way better in Leiston, Suffolk, UK ...unfortunately the place is way too far out of London. These were quite overpriced but much cheaper if you get them takeaway.

V0nwwT5u73RwcQLSRsPFAQ.text: Not good. We risked our health to try fried fish but alas, not as attempting as expected, fish is dry. Not satisfied!

nEOhvXSskVfrf3RaxNH8ZQ.text: The place is at the corner of be street, easy to find! The fish & chips were alright, a little dry. Overall still a good place to try. Love the sauce!

tGJoeh4n3Ad8J-ULvoZCwg.text: 4.5 stars, for the price, but overall the Best chippie experience I have had in London.   I will round up for that, because it is not to be missed and as I have found out, you can do much worse for fish and chips.  We sat outside on the patio, which had heaters for this time of year.  It was a great lunch.  I had the large cod, it was battered thin and crisp.  The fish steak was thick and very fresh tasting.  Good chips too...They have been making fish n chips here forever, and I think they claim to be the 3rd oldest chippie.  Regardless, it was very good, and despite prices that were a bit high, I can recommend as a nice and clean place to have Britains best cuisine.  You may be able to find a cheaper place, where oil drips through your paper, but it is hard to find one better than Rock and Sole.  Next time, I will have the halibut.

OHl83Lh2peg-eQFgdJLCjQ.text: This place was great. Fish is so fresh and the restaurant is in a good area near a lot of site seeing.

K-UHBGeTvjYu5rkd0uKYCA.text: I think i over hyped myself for fish & chips. First timer in London from Toronto, I've been looking forward to this meal for a long time. I ordered a large Plaice. The piece of fish was HUGE! I tried so hard and barely finished it. The fish was very fatty and delicious and crispy. However,  I didn't have that melt in my mouth feel that I expected. Maybe it's because of the oily fried taste, I didn't feel too good afterwards. The service was nothing special, the seating area felt like a diner. Very simple yet cozy. I will prob come back here if I'm ever in town again, and will get a small instead of large. I left the place smelling like fried fish for the rest of the day.

u3Hyq8uu_6exYJ_sGdLnIQ.text: Our first item on the agenda when we landed in London...try FISH & CHIPS! Thank you Yelp for having a presence in the UK! We did our research via Yelp and made the decision to try out the fish & chips @ Rock &  Sole Plaice based on the Yelp reviews.{ORDER}Fish + Chips - The batter had the right amount of crispiness + ratio of batter to fillet of fish. I liked the size of the chips (aka "fries"). What really made the dish was the tartar sauce. It was so creamy and full of deliciousness. It's probably the best tartar sauce I've ever had!{DON'T ORDER}Mushy peas which essentially is "mashed peas". It had zero flavor.{SERVICE}This place gets really busy. Don't even count on the service. There's also a seating area downstairs in the basement. So whatever you need, order and request it as soon as they take your order.{OVERALL}The locals eat here. It's not very touristy. This is a great place to get a good, quick meal in London!

Photo of Rock & Sole Plaice - London, United Kingdom. fish+chips!

kQCzVuyT4WWp_p_OVUJOIQ.text: Walked about 6 miles in circles to find this place (not because the location is hard to find...I'm just bad with directions) but it was so worth it.Affordable for fish & chips in London and like every other place I went to, take out is cheaper than eat in.  Service was wonderful.  Fish was perfectly crisp and fries were delicious.I also had the pickles and mushy peas, the latter was a huge portion!

_G2zylS_dpes4W-jpv4Grw.text: Great fish n chips. There's always a queue but this surely is a good sign. Open until late so an ideal place to head after a couple of drinks. Indoor and outdoor seating. Very popular with locals and tourists. Averagely priced. Quickly served. Traditional fish n chips at it's best. Serves all the extra sauces, curry sauce is a must.
